thread.title: Tarantino joins activists to protest police brutality in NY

author: WILLIAM MATHIS
title: Tarantino joins activists to protest police brutality in NY
text:
Patrick Sison Tarantino joins activists to protest police brutality in NY 
Director Quentin Tarantino, center, participates in a rally to protest against police brutality Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in New York. Speakers at the protest said they want to bring justice for those who were killed by police. (AP Photo/Patrick Sison) Patrick Sison Tarantino joins activists to protest police brutality in NY 
Dr. Cornel West, right, participates in a rally in New York against violence by police on Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015. Hundreds marched up Sixth Avenue. (AP Photo/Patrick Sison) Mary Altaffer Tarantino joins activists to protest police brutality in NY 
Demonstrators participate in rally against police brutality at Washington Square park in New York, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015. Speakers at the protest said they want to bring justice for those who were killed by police. (AP Photo/Mary Altaffer) Mary Altaffer Tarantino joins activists to protest police brutality in NY 
Marion Gray-Hopkins, speaks about the death of her son, Gary Hopkins Jr. in 1999, during a rally to protest against police brutality Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Mary Altaffer) Mary Altaffer Tarantino joins activists to protest police brutality in NY 
Demonstrators chant slogans during a rally to protest against police brutality Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in New York. Speakers at the protest said they want to bring justice for those who were killed by police. (AP Photo/Mary Altaffer) Patrick Sison Tarantino joins activists to protest police brutality in NY 
A demonstrator holds his hands in the air during a rally to protest against police brutality Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in New York. Speakers at the protest said they want to bring justice for those who were killed by police. (AP Photo/Patrick Sison) Posted: Saturday, October 24, 2015 2:43 pm | Updated: 5:03 pm, Sat Oct 24, 2015. 
NEW YORK (AP) â€” Academy Award-winning filmmaker Quentin Tarantino has joined hundreds of people rallying and marching through the streets of New York City to protest police brutality. 
The group rallied Saturday in Manhattan's Washington Square Park before marching about 2 miles along Sixth Avenue. Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety. You need an online service to view this article in its entirety. Have an online subscription?
